title: Pasta With Caramelized Onions And Bitter Greens
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Pasta With Caramelized Onions And Bitter Greens a try. This recipe serves 4 and costs $1.69 per serving. One portion of this dish contains roughly 20g of protein, 12g of fat, and a total of 570 calories. This recipe from Martha Stewart has 6 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. If you have chicken broth, butter, salt and pepper, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the unsalted butter you could follow this main course with the Almond Milk Chocolate Pudding as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 84%. This score is amazing. Try Risotto with Italian Sausage, Caramelized Onions, and Bitter Greens, Mashed Potatoes With Bitter Greens And Sweet Onions, and Beet Greens With Caramelized Onions for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
